data.title: Fix non-infantry support units starting on subcells. Fixes #5378
Show unknown map name under the minimap?
data.body:
How can i download it, if i dont know the map name? Some people kept asking what is the map name so they could download it, even when it actually was in resource center.

It would make more sense if you saw the mapname in all cases.

data.title: Show notification when trying to click ready when map is not installed
data.body: Some newbs doesnt know you have to install the map first.

data.title: Removed false damage states which caused invisible walls.  Fixes #5654
data.body:
This removes the final set of 16 images for each of the wall types in both RA and TD.  One of the pieces in particular makes the wall completely invisible, which is annoying and the cause for #5654.  This fixes that by getting rid of those last set of images.

`Explanation of why they are false damage states for walls + lengthy post warning:`
I'm not 100% sure by any means, but the final set of 16 images appear to be end pieces for the wall segments so that they look more "full".  If you build a single wall, then build one right next to it, you will notice that the original wall segment almost looks like it gets cut in half on the side not connected to the new wall segment.  I believe this space is supposed to be filled with the end pieces so that it looks more "full" and complete.

See the comparison below which shows what it looks like without these end pieces and with them on the center area where the vertical and horizontal wall segments meet together.

without them..
![withoutendpieces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7218092/3488325/0ac4fc58-04dd-11e4-90bd-3226049fd0c2.png)

and with them..
![withendpieces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7218092/3488326/21a6ae80-04dd-11e4-8128-fe2fff536327.png)

without the end pieces looks odd, as if it's missing something, and its very noticable when trying to place a new wall segment there.  I took the "with" end pieces picture by using the bleed version's bug where the final damage state is not a proper damage state, here you can clearly see that it is probably an end piece and not a proper damage state for the wall.  The final fix to make use of these end pieces is probably not that difficult, but will likely only be compatible with TD and RA, and not TS, so I would hate to introduce an incompatibility into the wall code if we expect to be able to make use of it for TS as well.  But for now, this removes the bogus wall damage states!

data.title: Increase Chinook landing speed and removed turn before landing.
data.body:
Fixes #5054, Allows for any helicopter to choose to turn to the initial facing before landing, and sets the default to disable the turn since this only affects the chinook.  I kept the previous functionality as a property because I thought it might make sense for single player for visual effect (Allies01) or for some other mod.

Increases the chinook's ascend/descend speed for faster landing as well.

Also documents some of the helicopter trait properties, since you can never have too much documentation.

data.title: Rewrite AI BaseBuilder and add tech levels to TD.
data.body:
The main blocker for tech levels was that they exposed the extreme dumbness of our AI base building.

This rewrites that part of the AI to be more sensible (there are still a couple of hacks carried over, and this doesn't touch any of the non-building AI bogosity), and implements four tech levels for TD:
- Low (everything before comm. center).
- Medium (everything before advanced comm. / temple).
- No Powers (everything except airstrike, nuke, ion cannon).
- Unrestricted (everything).

Fixes the bulk of #5416.

data.title: Fix breakage of the old Lua API due to recent changes
data.body:
Specifically, the CPos::CenterPosition -> Map::CenterOfCell rename (#5758),
as well as the additional argument to Paradrop::SetLZ (#5695).

data.title: Donâ€™t try to render the repair indicator if there are no repairers.
data.body: Fixes #5823.

data.title: AI: Metadata for support powers
data.body:
As per discussion in #2926, the idea is to add metadata to support powers that makes it easier for the AI to understand how to use the support power (to some degree).

Planned metadata:

```
"UseAgainst: Self, Ally, Neutral, Enemy" (1 only. Default: "Enemy")
"TargetType: {ActorType}, {ActorType}, ..." (1 or more. Default: "Air, Ground, Water")
"AvoidType: {ActorType}, {ActorType}, ..." (1 or more. Default: "")
"TargetDecision: HighestHealth, HighestValue, MostActors, LeastActors" (1 only. Default: "HighestValue")
"EffectiveRadius: 5c0" (Any world range. Default: 5c0)
```

Planned impact on AI "FindAttackLocationToSupportPower"
Currently always uses radius 5. Instead, EffectiveRadius should now be used.
Currently decision for an area is that it is the highest concentration of enemy units, and there are more enemies there than allies. Instead, it will now:
For each actor in the area that meets ANY TargetType tag will add to the attractiveness of the area.
For each actor in the area that meets ANY AvoidType tag will subtract from the attractiveness of the area.
The amount added/subtracted is decided by the TargetDecision. Where HighestHealth checks actor health. HighestValue checks actor costs. MostActors / LeastActors simply checks actor count.

data.title: Fixes TS FiendShard using wrong projectile
Re-implement Shadow support for Missiles
data.body:
Will be needed for TS, at least.

Also took this opportunity to remove lots of formerly bitrotted "Shadow: no/false" entries from the shipping mods. Shadow defaults to false as that's the wanted behaviour for all currently shipping mods, so these entries are obsolete anyway.

I intentionally left TS' weapons.yaml as-is, as a constant reminder that we need something like #3680 to make missile flight behaviour look good & realistic for TS/RA2 or similar projects which use isometric perspective.

data.title: Added the Helicarrier from the Aftermath expansion
data.body: It works a little different from http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Helicarrier as it can't store helis inside, but that made no sense to me. This is simply a water-borne helipad you can undeploy and move around.

data.title: Prioritize notStupidCells higher than availCells for Scatter
data.body:
Closes #4943.

Note: I have no clue whether smallfly was right about this, but since nothing seemed to happen about it and the proposed fix was simple enough, I figured a PR would be the quickest solution to get this issue reviewed and either fixed or closed.

data.title: Moved ProneDamage to Warhead
data.body:
This moves the ProneDamage multiplier from the TakeCover trait to weapons' Warhead.

Closes #5358.

data.title: Allied helipad - new unit causes existing helicopter to disappear
data.body:
I found this bug by sending an existing helicopter (hind) to be serviced on the helipad, while another was under construction. The helicopter was still on the pad at the point of completion of the new helicopter; when the construction was completed, only 1 unit left the helipad.

This was particularly noticeable as the existing unit was team 0 - after the new unit was created, team 0 was no longer assigned.

This looks related to the new behaviour of the allied helipad (previously it would have said "unable to build more" while another unit was on the pad, particularly if a queue was in place, but now they leave the pad automatically).
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2973961-allied-helipad-new-unit-causes-existing-helicopter-to-disappear?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Ship the July release
data.body:
The [changelog](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Changelog) now includes several important crash and bug fixes for the June release, a couple of big-ticket new features, and a pile of less important but still nice improvements.

This feels like a good time to stop accepting new features (but still allow self-contained polish and map fixes), clear the pull queue and remaining [blockers](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues?milestone=10&state=open), do the Mods.RA -> Mods.Common rename, and ship a new release before the end of the month.

data.title: Corrected d2k.sardaukar prone-shoot animation.
data.body:
Sardaukar prone-shoot facings where non-negative, causing the actor to face the opposite direction of its target when firing prone.

See issue #5816

data.title: Fixed chat commands crashing replays
data.body: This does not just fix #5755, but also the fact that chat commands were sent also via a regular chat order so they would be executed on _all_ clients who read the chat and watch them for strings starting with `/`. It just crashed because on replays the local client is null, but in fact this is a serious exploit especially in combination with https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5701! We also don't need to send a new Order.Chat and hide the received output later, because all Chat/Player/DevCommands issue proper network orders themselves once invoked.

data.title: D2K: Sardaukar prone firing animation rotation reversed.
data.body:
Currently the sequence in infantry.yaml for the sardaukar reads:

```
prone-shoot: DATA
        Start: 1058
        Length: 6
        Facings: 8
        Transpose: true
```

Unlike all the other sardaukar sequence facings that are negative instead.

This results in the sardaukar facing in the wrong direction when firing while prone.

Code should read:

```
prone-shoot: DATA
        Start: 1058
        Length: 6
        Facings: -8
        Transpose: true
```

Tested, the above fix works.

data.title: Fixed units not moving to the RallyPoint
data.body:
I played around and made some observations.
- `public int nearEnough = 1;` is the only value that makes sense as 0 crashes the game and 2 will be too far away for the default exit and rally point distance. Also the value is looked up somewhere else and not even configurable so why was this even a public field.
- MoveWithinRange seems to be a bad choice for rally point movement as units are allowed to give up too early. We want them to move directly to that point not stand somewhere near it blocking the exit. This fixes #5682.

The StyleCop violations and legacy int[] fields to parse a 2D vector coordinate make this look like code that has not been touched for years. Hope this removes some bit rot.

data.title: Instant filtering by file name in the asset browser
data.body: The filter matches partial file names, is case-insensitive and is applied instantly, without clicking a button.

data.title: Fixed the AI choosing rallypoints on land for shipyards
data.body: I hope this improves Naval AI and performance as it avoids impossible pathings. It should also help prevent problems when people create mods and get confused because the AI crashes as it relies on a `fact` actor somewhere in the rules although it is listed in no production queues.

data.title: Random pauses during missions with windows executable version
data.body: When using the downloaded data version of the game, on both RA and TD, mission will pause randomly anywhere from 38 s to 95 s and no further progress can be made. I have found no way of making the game continue.
